image.altText: Glenn Maxwell and Mitchell Marsh after the loss to India

props.synopsis: Australia will require a helping hand from Bangladesh later today in order to qualify for the T20 World Cup semi finals after a heavy loss to India in a crucial Super Eights clash.

title.children: Australia in danger of T20 World Cup exit after 'disappointing' loss to India in crucial clash

image.altText: a composite image of two female aboriginal politicians

props.synopsis: Federal MP Marion Scrymgour says she has engaged a lawyer after Lidia Thorpe suggested she had taken advantage of COVID-19 stimulus money while she was chief executive of the Northern Land Council.

title.children: Federal MP to take legal action against Victorian senator Lidia Thorpe over COVID fund allegations

image.altText: Princess Anne in a vibrant purple jacket with matching scarf and hat

props.synopsis: Princess Anne has sustained minor injuries and a concussion following an incident on the Gatcombe Park estate on Sunday evening, according to a statement from the Buckingham Palace.Â

title.children: Princess Anne in hospital after sustaining concussion and minor head injuries, says Buckingham Palace

image.altText: five colourful vapes standing on a black-coloured counter

props.synopsis: Vapes will be banned from sale outside pharmacies, but adults will not need a prescription to buy them, as the federal government agrees to water down its proposed ban to win over the Greens.

title.children: Pharmacist fury at deal for vapes to be restricted to pharmacies-only, without adults needing prescription

image.altText: Picasso artwork hanging in a toilet cubicle.

props.synopsis: Multiple artworks by Pablo Picasso have been relocated to a female toilet at Hobart's Mona, following an adverse court ruling which found a man was discriminated against when he was turned away from the women-only 'Ladies Lounge'.

title.children: Picasso artworks put in female toilet as part of art gallery response to court ruling

image.altText: A woman in handcuffs is led down the stairs of a court house by a group of men.

props.synopsis: A North Queensland mother told the court she was exercising her "right to self determination" before later being arrested and led from the building by police.

title.children: Mum charged with alleged murder of two-year-old daughter locked up after court drama

image.altText: roofs of houses, most of them with solar panels

props.synopsis: The Coalition wants nuclear to be the Yin to rooftop solar's Yang. But some experts say the technologies make terrible bedfellows.Â

title.children: Behind the grand plans for nuclear is a potentially fatal flaw. And it's on millions of roofs

image.altText: Lyrella Couzens smiles in a colourful, summer dress. Her parents sit in chairs behind her looking happy and relaxed.

props.synopsis: When my elderly parents decided to sell everything and leave their very full life in regional Victoria to retire to Bali, my siblings and I were worried.Â

title.children: At 80, Mum and Dad finally decided to retire â to Bali

image.altText: two aboriginal women making bracelets at a table

props.synopsis:
In a jurisdiction with some of the highest reoffending rates in Australia, a rehabilitation service helping former prisoners conquer addiction is being evicted to make way for a new women's prison.


Â

title.children: Darwin rehab treating former prisoners with addiction to be replaced by new prison

image.altText: A woman looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Former nurse Lucy Letby, convicted last year of murdering seven babies and trying to kill six others, is on trial accused of the attempted murder of a further baby girl.

title.children: Convicted UK nurse Lucy Letby says she never harmed any babies

image.altText: group of lifeguards, most with faces blurred

props.synopsis: A paedophile water polo coach convicted of grooming a child for sex in Australia has been deported from the UK after the ABC found him working as a children's lifeguard at a family water park.

title.children: Paedophile water polo coach deported from UK after he was found working as childrenâs lifeguard

image.altText: wine glasses

props.synopsis: Tens of thousands of dollars spent by Treasury on food, alcohol and venues for its budget night functions breached probity laws and internal policies.

title.children: Treasury's boozy 'budget binge' broke its own rules

image.altText: Premier Jacinta Allan standing at a microphone.

props.synopsis: Victoria will trial pill testing of illicit drugs this summer, Premier Jacinta Allan has announced, saying it was "a common sense way to save lives".

title.children: Victorian government announces pill testing trial to start this summer

image.altText: An empty Westfield Marion.

props.synopsis: Teenagers brandishing a machete and extendable batons â who were attempting to steal a jumper from another teen â sparked a lockdown of Westfield Marion shopping centre, Adelaide's Youth Court has heard. A lawyer for one of the accused has denied there were "knives or machetes involved".

title.children: Machete and batons allegedly 'brandished' by teenagers before lockdown of Adelaide shopping centre

image.altText: Entry to the Kununurra Courthouse from the street

props.synopsis: Kununurra Children's Court heard an 11-year-old boy involved in stealing cars was missing school while being easily led by teenagers who roamed the streets at night.

title.children: Boy's crime spree in outback town raises concerns over home life, school attendance

image.altText: A large white balloon carrying a bad of trash hovers over a rice field.

props.synopsis: It appeared to be North Korea "expressing extreme hostility toward the leaflet campaigns and to highlight the adversarial stance against South Korea".

title.children: Here's what South Korea says was inside North Korea's trash balloons

image.altText: A woman holding a shopping bag walks slowly along a wide footpath before a blast and fireball erupts near her

props.synopsis: As Russia's aerial bombardment of Kharkiv in north-east Ukraine continues, Russian authorities say falling debris from Ukrainian missiles has killed people in the illegally-annexed territory of Crimea.Â

title.children: Woman escapes missile fireball in Ukraine's Kharkhiv as attack kills three people

image.altText: A man concealing his face stands in front of a roadblock and a small fire at night.

props.synopsis: A new wave of unrest has hit New Caledonia amid warnings the decision to send seven activists charged over deadly riots to France has mobilised pro-independence supporters.

title.children: New wave of violence in New Caledonia as activists sent 17,000km away to detention in France

image.altText: Badge on the sleeve of Australian Federal Police officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: A 31-year-old man is arrested after two alleged attempted abductions of women in Mawson. Police say he is likely to face court on Tuesday.

title.children: Arrest made after two women claim a man tried to abduct them while out exercising in Canberra

image.altText: Two cctv photos of a man holding a gun inside banks.

props.synopsis: South Australia's notorious "bicycle bandit" has been handed a 35-year sentence for a series of armed bank robberies, but will serve very little time in prison.

title.children: Terminally-ill 'bicycle bandit' handed 35-year sentence, but court told his death is imminent

image.altText: Amy Yang, in red shirt and white bucket hat, has champagne poured on her by other golfers after winning the PGA Championship.

props.synopsis: The top two Australians at the Women's PGA Championship finish in a tie for 24th, but honorary Australian Amy Yang takes the win after a series of near misses.

title.children: Former Gold Coast high school prodigy wins Women's PGA Championship

image.altText: A close up of Greg Lynn standing in front of a body of water near some rocks.

props.synopsis: A note from the jury read in part: "What happens if we are unable to reach a unanimous decision?"

title.children: Greg Lynn jury told to continue deliberations after question over unanimous verdict

image.altText: An emergency worker in an orange uniform.

props.synopsis: A fire at a lithium battery factory in South Korea has claimed the lives of at least 22 people, with eight injured, according to local fire officials.

title.children: At least 22 people found dead after fire breaks out at South Korean battery plant

image.altText: A composite image of Cara Delevingne, Sabrina Carpenter and Ivy Getty.

props.synopsis: The third iteration of Vogue World has set up camp in the French capital ahead of next month's Olympics, putting on a parade in the city's Place VendÃ´me.

title.children: All the looks from Vogue World: Paris as Serena Williams and Sabrina Carpenter make surprise runway cameos

image.altText: Two women sit on an unfinished deck outside a converted shed. They are looking at the camera with neutral expression.

props.synopsis: The mystery of what went wrong at one of Australia's biggest fertility clinics haunts this couple.

title.children: 'We got the wrong sperm': Anastasia and Lexie are living an IVF nightmare. The clinic won't take responsibility

image.altText: Aaron Karl Labrook leaving court.

props.synopsis: A Rebels bikie gang leader who claimed his murdered predecessor was spending club funds on home renovations is found guilty of possessing more than $450,000 in cash suspected of being unlawfully obtained.

title.children: Boss of bikie gang in 'disarray' found guilty of possessing more than $450,000 in unlawful cash

image.altText: Craig Townsend 2024-06-21 08:06:00

props.synopsis: If you want to get a sense of the "insane" nature of Perth's property market right now and the breakneck speed at which homes are selling, look no further than Craig Townsend's experiences last week.

title.children: How 'crazy' is Perth's housing market? Ask Craig Townsend, who just lost out on a home literally at the last minute

image.altText: An image of an unidentifiable police officer whos head can't be seen, with their hands on their hips wearing a high vis vest.

props.synopsis: Victoria Police believe a "targeted attack" was carried out at a Ballarat property early on Monday morning, which led to a man being take to hospital with a suspected gunshot wound.

title.children: Man hospitalised with suspected gunshot wound as police investigate 'targeted attack'

image.altText: a queenslander, mid-rise and high-rise in a graphic

props.synopsis: The Beyond Reach report has found affordable housing â where housing costs are 30 per cent or less of income â has "almost ceased to exist" for essential workers in south-east Queensland.Â

title.children: Buying a home in Queensland now 'beyond reach' for many frontline workers, report finds

image.altText: A man stands smiling on stage, strumming a guitar around his neck. He wears a grey button up shirt.

props.synopsis: After being arrested in the Hamptons last week, the pop singer has resumed his world tour.

title.children: 'I know sometimes I'm hard to love': Justin Timberlake addresses DWI charge for first time

image.altText: a man standing at a podium with his hand up against his ear pretending to speak into a phone

props.synopsis: The Liberal Party's most recognisable climate campaigner has been tapped by Labor to assume Australia's top climate advisory role.

title.children: Liberal Matt Kean, long a thorn in his own party's side, has been offered a job by Labor

image.altText: A shed on a property

props.synopsis: Police say a complex investigation has led to charges of murder, burglary and arson against an 18-year-old man.

title.children: Teenager charged with murder more than two years after fire that killed Queensland man at his home

image.altText: Nuclear power station chimneys

props.synopsis: Project management, legal and energy experts have raised serious doubts about the Coalitions ability to construct nuclear power plants in Australia before 2037.

title.children: Physicist willing to bet 'large amounts of money' against nuclear power being built in Australia in his lifetime
